contest-event.event-date: Sept. 25, 1920 D National Championship of Great Britain (Crystal Palace) National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) 1 Test Piece Contest National Championship of Great Britain (Finals) national-finals-championship-section European Championships The current Nationals contest began in 1900, but there was a previous 'Nationals' contest run 40 years earlier: Enderby Jackson's Great National Contest. Championship Coriolanus Crystal Palace (Concert Hall), Crystal Palace Park, Sydenham, County of London, England, UK Either Mansfield Colliery or Harton Colliery played 15th as opposed to 5th. The reserve adjudicator was Charles Ward. Prizes: 1st: 100 Pounds plus the 1000 Guinea Trophy 2nd: 50 Pounds plus the Daily Telegraph Challenge Cup 3rd: 30 Pounds 4th: 20 Pounds 5th: 15 Pounds The piece commissioned for the cancelled 1914 contest ('Coriolanus') was used at this next contest in the series. May 12, 2010, 5:10 p.m. Sept. 2, 2013, 3:11 p.m. 1 St. Hilda Colliery William Halliwell 2 City of Lincoln Band William Halliwell 3 Irwell Springs J. A.
